intro: Notoxylinon australe, commonly known as the Australian sandalwood, is a small, evergreen shrub native to the arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody capsules containing several seeds. It is well adapted to dry climates and has a slow growth rate, making it a valuable but rare species in its native habitat.
